title: Android Weekly Issue #650
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Why your mobile releases are a black box “What’s the status of the release?” Who knows. Uncover the unseen challenges that keep mobile development shrouded in mystery and drain your team’s efficiency. Discover how to break open the black box, enhance communication, and finally bring clarity to your release cycle. Type-Safe Navigation in Jetpack Compose: Passing Custom Classes Anil Kumar Beesetti looks at the long-awaited type safety added to Jetpack Navigation library, making navigation between destinations more robust, intuitive, and of-course safe. Test smarter, not harder: new testing strategies documentation Jose Alcérreca announces a significant update to our official documentation on testing strategies for Android developers. Sponsored Genius Scan SDK: a document scanner in your app Embed a reliable document scanner with OCR in your app, enabling your customers to capture high-quality, legible documents that you can process effortlessly. Hundreds of companies and millions of users trust the Genius Scan technology. Supports Android, iOS, and cross-platform frameworks. Widgets With Glance: Beyond String States Katie Barnett demonstrates using a CustomGlanceStateDefinition for managing complex GlanceWidget state. Demystifying Maestro’s UI Testing Implementation Sam Edwards shares some discoveries about the inner workings of Maestro with TONS of links to their open source implementation. Achieving Type-safe Navigation Results in AndroidX Compose for KMP FunkyMuse explores how to implement callback results between screens while maintaining complete type safety. Random Musings on the Android 16 Developer Preview 1 Mark Murphy rummages through the API differences report for Android 16 DP 1 Google Maps in Jetpack Compose: Polylines Joe Birch dives into the Polyline composable and shows how we can draw coordinate-based lines on our map. How to create a scrollable chart in Compose Multiplatform Alex Zhukovich creates a "Vertical Bar Chart" which will work on all platforms. Centering in Compose Zach Klippenstein explains the theory behind “centering” in Compose without assuming you know anything about the specifics of Compose's layout system. Gradle 8.11: Faster Configuration Cache and Improved Configuration Time Iñaki Villar examines Gradle 8.11, which introduces new improvements to the configuration cache process. From Compile Safety to Configuration Safety: Let's Build the Koin IDE Plugin The Kotzilla team announces the upcoming release of the Koin IDE Plugin. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code Strikt Strikt is an assertion library for Kotlin intended for use with a test runner such as JUnit, Minutest or Spek. KMPDevicePreview Kotlin & Compose Multiplatform library to simulate any device from any platform, supporting Android, iOS, JVM, JS, and WebAssembly. Akkurate Akkurate is a validation library taking advantage of the expressive power of Kotlin compose_edge_to_edge_preview Library which enables you to show WindowInsets in Jetpack Compose previews News The First Developer Preview of Android 16 Android 16 Developer Preview 1 is available now to test with your apps. Introducing Restore Credentials: Effortless account restoration for Android apps Google introduces Restore Credentials, a new feature of Android’s Credential Manager API. Join us at the Women in AI Summit 2024! The Women in AI Summit is back on December 3, 2024 from 9:30am to 1:00pm PT! Join virtually for this inclusive event for anyone passionate about Artificial Intelligence (AI). Announcing the Winners of the Gemini API Developer Competition! Meet the winners of the Gemini API Developer Competition! State of Kotlin Scripting 2024 JetBrains considers the evolution of scripting in Kotlin Tools Compose Libraries Discover libraries for Jetpack Compose and Compose Multiplatform. Videos & Podcasts Animating Your World with Doris Liu Dive into Jetpack Compose Animations and learn some Compose magic! Anonymous Functions Aren't Lambdas Dave Leeds checks out what anonymous functions are and when we might want to use them. Strikt - a Powerful Assertion Library for Kotlin! Charfaoui Younes explores a powerful library for assertion in kotlin called Strikt, along with code examples and setup instructions to get started using it! How to Deserialize Inconsistent JSON Data With a Custom Kotlinx Serializer Philipp Lackner shows how you can implement a custom serializer with Kotlinx serialization to parse differing JSON structures, for example when the API has not been designed with mobile in mind. Platform Integrations in Kotlin Multiplatform with Russell Wolf Sebastian and Márton are joined by Russell Wolf to discuss different code sharing approaches for Kotlin Multiplatform, and how to build great multiplatform libraries. Firebase Demo Day 2024 Watch demos from Firebase Demo Day to learn how you can build and run modern, AI-powered app experiences users love with Firebase. Specials Interview with Kotlin lead designer: How far will the language diverge from Java? Kotlin lead designer Michail Zarečenskij spoke to DevClass about the relationship with Java and the future of the language. Android Dev Quest Android Dev Quest is an interactive puzzle game that will challenge you to think creatively and push yourself to new levels

html:
“What’s the status of the release?” Who knows. Uncover the unseen challenges that keep mobile development shrouded in mystery and drain your team’s efficiency. Discover how to break open the black box, enhance communication, and finally bring clarity to your release cycle.

Embed a reliable document scanner with OCR in your app, enabling your customers to capture high-quality, legible documents that you can process effortlessly. Hundreds of companies and millions of users trust the Genius Scan technology. Supports Android, iOS, and cross-platform frameworks.

Zach Klippenstein explains the theory behind “centering” in Compose without assuming you know anything about the specifics of Compose's layout system.

Strikt is an assertion library for Kotlin intended for use with a test runner such as JUnit, Minutest or Spek.

Kotlin & Compose Multiplatform library to simulate any device from any platform, supporting Android, iOS, JVM, JS, and WebAssembly.

Akkurate is a validation library taking advantage of the expressive power of Kotlin

The Women in AI Summit is back on December 3, 2024 from 9:30am to 1:00pm PT! Join virtually for this inclusive event for anyone passionate about Artificial Intelligence (AI).

Watch demos from Firebase Demo Day to learn how you can build and run modern, AI-powered app experiences users love with Firebase.

Android Dev Quest is an interactive puzzle game that will challenge you to think creatively and push yourself to new levels

]]>
